item.description: Two father-son shuttle launch photos, taken thirty years apart, immediately went viral on Flickr http://t.co/ermVE4M
item.content:encoded: Two father-son shuttle launch photos, taken thirty years apart, immediately went viral on Flickr http://t.co/ermVE4M Read 'Two photos, thirty years apart, move the Web' from our blog The Upshot on Yahoo! News. Thirty years ago, the first space shuttle launched into the stratosphere. Chris Bray and his father Kenneth watched -- and took a picture. Then last Friday, the shuttle Atlantis took its final trip. Again, the Bray men were there. And again, the two snapped a photo to capture the moment. The side-by-side photos, which are [...] Link - Trackbacks

item.content:encoded: Live traffic data in Google Maps now available for 13 countries in Europe - http://t.co/FDftvsY Since introducing the live traffic feature on Google Maps in 2008, our team has been working hard to make this feature available to more users in more countries. Just in time for summer travel, we’re delighted to announce that today we’re making traffic available in 13 countries in Europe. Now you have a new set of problems: How do you scale your application and services to meet your growing demand? How do you manage multiple Linodes all participating as a single system? item.title: Manning-Lamo Chat Logs Revealed | Threat Level | Wired.com
item.description: Wired.com publishes the full chat logs between @6 and @bmanningfm. http://t.co/ahayIuI #manning #lamo #wikileaks
item.content:encoded: Wired.com publishes the full chat logs between @6 and @bmanningfm. http://t.co/ahayIuI #manning #lamo #wikileaks A little more than a year ago, Wired.com published excerpts from instant messenger chats between accused WikiLeaks source Bradley Manning and Adrian Lamo, the ex-hacker in whom he confided and who reported him to the authorities. It's now time to reveal the previously unpublished portions of these conversations. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: wired.com
